definition: a pretext for gossip/a matter for derision
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
handle or shaft (of an axe etc)/(of a flower, leaf or fruit) stem/sth that affords an advantage to an opponent/classifier for knives or blades

sentences.english: Her disheveled appearance when she arrives is meat for Caroline's gossip, but Mrs.
sentences.chinese: 她到達時的狼狽相，爲卡羅琳說長道短提供了話柄。

sentences.english: You have made us a byword among the nations; the peoples shake their heads at us.
sentences.chinese: 你使我們在列國中成爲話柄，在萬民中使人搖頭。

sentences.english: But his support for the Iraq war will be fodder for attacks.
sentences.chinese: 但是他對伊拉克戰爭的支持將成爲話柄。

sentences.english: Her disheveled appearance when she arrives is meat for Caroline's gossip.
sentences.chinese: 她到達時的狼狽相，爲卡羅琳說長道短提供了話柄。
